title: BBC History - Royal Women 2016 (gnv64)
description:
BBC History - Royal Women 2016
English | 116 pages | True PDF | 21.6 mb

CONTENTS
6 Opinion: From Warrior Queens to Quiet Radicals - Tracy Borman explains how the roles of Britainâ€™s royal women have changed over the centuries

RULING QUEENS
10 Queen Boudica: Scourge of the Roman Empire - Vanessa Collingridge tells the story of the woman who led a native Briton army
16 Mary: Queen Against the Odds - Anna Whitelock argues that, despite her dark reputation, Mary Tudor was a political pioneer
24 Elizabeth I: The Monarch Behind the Mask - Anna Whitelock looks beyond Elizabeth Iâ€™s crafted image and finds a balding, frail woman
32 Anne: Daughter and Heir - The last Stuart monarch was a popular and effective queen, says Tracy Borman
36 How Do You Solve a Problem Like Victoria? - Kate Williams explores the challenges that Victoria had to overcome to gain the throne
44 Elizabeth II: Saving the Royal Family - The current Queen has become one of Britainâ€™s most successful monarchs, says Kate Williams

QUEENS WITHOUT THE CROWN
52 Medieval Queens - Lisa Hilton discovers that Englandâ€™s medieval queens played key roles in the nationâ€™s governance
58 Catherine of Aragon: Spainâ€™s Virgin Queen? - Giles Tremlett dissects a controversy that dogged the end of Henry VIIIâ€™s marriage to his first wife
62 Why Did Anne Boleyn Have to Die? - Was Anne ensnared by a conspiracy, the victim of her own loose tongue, or simply guilty as charged? Suzannah Lipscomb investigates
70 A Witness to the Six Wives - Lauren Mackay reveals what one manâ€™s writings can tell us about Henry VIIIâ€™s spouses
78 Faking Jane - Leanda de Lisle tells the tragic story of Lady Jane Grey, the nine-day queen who was sent to the executionerâ€™s block by Mary Tudor
82 Elizabeth: Cromwellâ€™s Shadowy Queen - Simon Guerrier investigates the mysterious life of Elizabeth Cromwell, Englandâ€™s first lady in the mid-17th century
86 Royal Mistresses - From passionate paramours to illegitimate children, Tracy Borman looks at some notable royal affairs down the centuries

MARRIED TO A PRINCE
92 The Vilification of Wallis Simpson - Susan Williams reveals why the woman for whom Edward VIII gave up the throne was savaged by Britainâ€™s establishment
98 Diana: Rebel Princess - Sarah Gristwood recalls and analyses a tragically short life lived in the full glare of expectancy and speculation
104 Kate Middleton: A Modern Royal Woman - Prince Williamâ€™s â€˜commonerâ€™ bride has transformed the royal family, catapulting it
into the 21st century, argues Sarah Gristwood
110 Momentous Royal Births - Kate Williams traces the monarchyâ€™s insatiable quest down the centuries to produce heirs to the throne
